explanation:
To determine whether OS_ObjectIdFindByName (or any callees it invokes) violates the MISRA rule forbidding use of memcmp to compare null-terminated strings, the analyzer needs the following symbols:

- OS_ObjectIdGetByName: Called directly by the target. Inspect its implementation for any string comparisons (e.g. use of memcmp) performed while resolving a name.
- OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch: Callee of OS_ObjectIdGetByName. The offending memcmp usage (if any) may be in this deeper search routine.
- ARGCHECK: Macro used on the name parameter. Its expansion may perform checks or comparisons on the name (possibly using string routines); the macro body must be inspected.
- LENGTHCHECK: Macro used to validate name length (uses OS_MAX_API_NAME). Its expansion may call string functions (strlen/memcmp/strncmp) — include to verify no memcmp-on-NT-strings occurs here.
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: Called by the target when a lookup succeeds. The release path could perform name-related comparisons in some implementations; include to be thorough.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish: Callee of OS_ObjectIdRelease; include in case string comparisons occur there.
- memcmp: The Standard Library function itself — the analysis must find any direct uses of memcmp in the above symbols and determine whether it is being (mis)used to compare null-terminated strings.
- OS_MAX_API_NAME: Constant used by LENGTHCHECK; needed to understand how LENGTHCHECK validates strings (e.g. to see if bounds/length checks avoid memcmp misuse).

Inspecting the implementations/definitions of these symbols will let the next agent detect any memcmp calls and determine whether they are being used to compare null-terminated strings (a MISRA violation).
